parameter 1: This movie was originally produced and aired on cable TV at 101 minutes. When it came out on VHS, it was cut down to 98 minutes, and the cuts were sloppy and arbitrary. Then a UK version came out on DVD. This too was cut (to 85 minutes), and many of their cuts were completely different than the 98 minute version. This is why many of the reviews are so bad. The movie, in its truncated form, doesn't flow. The only way you can see the original movie with its original comedy timing in tact is through Pirromount's website.
parameter 2: The German TV-version has got a few cuts to get a 'not under 12' rating.
parameter 3: For its original release, the Australian film board required that almost every scene involving a monster be removed before release.
parameter 4: For its original release, the Australian film board required that almost every scene involving a monster be removed before release.
parameter 5: The TV-episode version of this film substitutes the voice of 'Vic Perrin' (qv) for 'William Conrad (I)' (qv) during scenes involving the Draconia.
parameter 6: Available in rated and unrated versions
parameter 7: A version of the movie exists which is divided into three 12-minute episodes.
parameter 8: The TV-episode version of this film substitutes the voice of 'Vic Perrin' (qv) for 'William Conrad (I)' (qv) during scenes involving the Draconia.

parameter 16: This movie was originally produced and aired on cable TV at 101 minutes. When it came out on VHS, it was cut down to 98 minutes, and the cuts were sloppy and arbitrary. Then a UK version came out on DVD. This too was cut (to 85 minutes), and many of their cuts were completely different than the 98 minute version. This is why many of the reviews are so bad. The movie, in its truncated form, doesn't flow. The only way you can see the original movie with its original comedy timing in tact is through Pirromount's website.
parameter 17: The original theatrical release received a "12" rating in the UK without any cuts however, the video release was rated "15" with 11 seconds cut. The scene in which Lothos ignites Buffy's cross was removed and instead of immolating his head, she merely flees. At the time, the "12" rating did not cover video releases, only theatrical so it was rated "15" and the scenes in question may be imitated by younger viewers. In 2002, all previous cuts were waived and the video release was rated "15".
parameter 18: For its original release, the Australian film board required that almost every scene involving a monster be removed before release.
